page.title: 06I'M BECROM AND I'M A HINDU
page.content: My Mum and Dad were born in India but my father left to join the British Army in Cyprus as he could not find work. He is now employed at the Rover works in Solihull. We belong to the Bengali Association and meet with other Hindu's as there are very few where we live. In our religion the cow is sacred to us so we do not eat red meat. The Ganges in India is our sacred river. In October every year we have our most important festival called Puja. It lasts for 3 days and celebrates a God called Duga. Duga was powerful with ten arms each with a weapon, who fought and killed a devil who had immense powers that no other God could match.
